definition: say things that are only partially true (used as a euphemism for 'lie').
example: I was once economical with the truth on a job application form.

definition: describe sth in a way that makes it sound better than it is.
example: He often talks things up, especially when our sales were down.
persian: چیزی را تعریف و تمجید کردن/بزرگنمایی کردن

definition: make a statement or story more interesting by adding details that are not always true.
example: I embellished my previous salary by a few thousand.
persian: چیزی را شاخ و برگ دادن/آراستن

definition: deliberately avoid talking about sth unpleasant, or say as little as possible about it.
example: I glossed over one rather unpalatable truth.
persian: چیزی را لاپوشانی کردن/سرسری رد شدن

definition: unpleasant and hard to accept.
example: I glossed over one rather unpalatable truth.

definition: used to introduce more exact information about a subject.
example: namely that I'd been sacked from my last job.

definition: make sth continue for some time.
example: Trying to sustain the lies at the interview was a nightmare.

definition: discover or notice sth, especially sth that is hard to see or hear.
example: My interviewer soon detected something was wrong.

definition: become worse. (N: deterioration)
example: A friendly chat deteriorated into an awful interrogation.

definition: the process of asking sb a lot of questions, especially in an aggressive way. (V: interrogate sb)
example: She virtually gave him loads of difficult questions/The chat deteriorated into an awful interrogation.

definition: make sb make a mistake which shows they have been lying.
example: He caught me out after a series of awkward questions.
persian: مچ کسی را گرفتن/کسی را دروغگو از آب درآوردن

definition: feeling ashamed because you have lost the respect of other people. (V: humiliate sb, N: humiliation)
example: I felt utterly humiliated.

definition: obviously.
example: Needless to say, I've never done it since.

definition: announce the start of war or a ceasefire.
example: The rebels have declared a ceasefire.

definition: sth that is destroyed or sb who suffers when sth else happens.
example: When war is declared, truth is the first casualty.

definition: twist or change facts, etc. so that they are no longer true.
example: He distorted the facts.

definition: tell the truth and not hide any important facts.
example: Level with your child by being honest.

definition: a person who is not honest or sincere. (Adj: phoney)
example: Nobody spots a phoney quicker than a child.

definition: in such a way that the speaker's name is kept secret. (N: anonymity)
example: Tell the complete truth anonymously.

definition: after sb has died.
example: He was awarded the medal posthumously.

definition: make sb feel confused because they don't understand sth. (Syns: baffle sb, confound sb FML. Adj: puzzled)
example: Tell the truth so as to puzzle and confound your adversaries.

definition: an enemy or opponent.
example: Tell the truth so as to puzzle and confound your adversaries.

definition: trick sb by behaving dishonestly (also deceive yourself refuse to admit that sth unpleasant is true SYN delude yourself). (N: deceit, deception)
example: We deceive ourselves.

definition: is a lie.
example: The most dangerous of all falsehoods is a slightly distorted truth.

definition: a small lie, especially one you tell to avoid hurting someone.
example: A white lie is a small lie, especially one you tell to avoid hurting someone.

definition: a statement which only gives some of the facts.
example: That's a half-truth. They're all on your pizzas!

definition: an unimportant lie.
example: A fib is an unimportant lie.

definition: not important. (Opp: major).
example: The design is a minor problem.

definition: increasing in size, amount, or degree.
example: Obesity is a growing problem.

definition: requiring immediate action.
example: Lack of funds is an urgent issue.

definition: always existing and not seeming to change.
example: Noise is a perennial problem.

definition: unable to be solved. (SYN insurmountable FML).
example: The problem seems insoluble.

definition: start to exist. (SYN occur / come up).
example: Various problems have arisen.

definition: mention sth for people to discuss.
example: I raised the problem of staffing.

definition: If problems confront sb, they appear and have to be dealt with by sb. (SYN face sb).
example: There are a number of problems confronting the head teacher.

definition: deal with a problem or difficult situation. (SYN face up to sth).
example: She's had to confront the fact that she can no longer walk.

definition: think about a difficult situation and decide how to deal with it.
example: We've got to address the lack of experience in the team.

definition: begin to understand and deal with sth difficult.
example: I'm just beginning to get to grips with my new job.
persian: با چیزی دست و پنجه نرم کردن/مسلط شدن

definition: make a big effort to deal with a problem.
example: They must tackle inflation.
persian: با چیزی دست و پنجه نرم کردن/اقدام کردن

definition: succeed in dealing with a problem that has been preventing you from achieving sth.
example: The company had to overcome a number of financial difficulties.

definition: make an existing problem worse. (SYN aggravate sth).
example: We must be careful not to exacerbate the problem.

definition: damage sb's confidence, etc.
example: This can dent their self-esteem.
persian: (اعتماد به نفس) کسی را تضعیف کردن

definition: the way you feel about yourself (high/low self-esteem).
example: This can dent their self-esteem.

definition: treat sth as unimportant. (OPP take sth seriously).
example: Don't make light of these worries.

definition: not important or serious.
example: Don't make light of these worries even if they seem trivial to you.

definition: accept and deal with a difficult situation without letting it worry you.
example: Some teenagers take failure in their stride.
persian: با آرامش با چیزی کنار آمدن/مواجه شدن

definition: If sth gets you down it makes you feel sad or depressed.
example: Others let it get them down.

definition: not allow a problem to have too much importance.
example: Help your teen to keep things in perspective.
persian: چیزی را در چارچوب درست دیدن/اهمیت واقعی دادن

definition: a problem that delays or prevents progress.
example: Everyone has setbacks in life.

definition: say or do sth that makes sb less worried. (SYN set sb's mind at rest).
example: Reassure them that you're behind them 100 per cent.
persian: به کسی اطمینان خاطر دادن/دلگرمی دادن

definition: give your support to sb/sth.
example: I will support him, because she loves him (His mother will support him).

definition: without being affected or influenced by sth.
example: Regardless of what happens.

definition: express your thoughts clearly in words. (Adj: articulate).
example: Find it difficult to identify and articulate how they feel.
persian: چیزی را به وضوح بیان کردن

definition: a system or method for sending or obtaining information.
example: Keep channels of communication open.

definition: (of a building) old and in very bad condition. (SYNS run-down, ramshackle).
example: We saw this amazing, dilapidated house.

definition: in earlier times. (SYN previously).
example: The house was formerly owned by a wealthy family.

definition: leave a place, vehicle, etc. empty without planning to return.
example: The house was abandoned at the end of the century.

definition: keep sth in its original state or in good condition. (N: preservation).
example: Some features are very well preserved.

definition: gradually be destroyed through lack of care.
example: Most of it is pretty run-down and has fallen into decay.

definition: repair and decorate an old building, car, etc. (SYN do sth up INF).
example: It could be a lot of fun renovating it.

definition: buildings in which horses are kept.
example: It has old stables.

definition: extremely (modern) (also ultra-cautious).
example: Convert it into an ultra-modern kitchen.

definition: parts of a building that remain after it has been destroyed.
example: There are also the ruins of a medieval tower.

definition: connected with the Middle Ages (= about 1000 to 1450).
example: the ruins of a medieval tower.

definition: find the origin or cause of sth.
example: I'd love to trace the history of the place.
persian: منشأ چیزی را پیدا کردن/ردیابی کردن

definition: completely new.
example: Brand new Sasko G5000 mobile phone.

definition: the most advanced (technology) in the field.
example: cutting-edge technology at its very best.

definition: featuring or introducing new ideas, methods, etc.
example: Innovative anti-snore device.

definition: an object or piece of equipment designed to do a particular job.
example: Innovative anti-snore device.

definition: modern (out of date = old-fashioned, or without the most recent information and therefore no longer useful).
example: Up-to-date guidebook to Korea.

definition: not new; owned by sb else before.
example: Second-hand but good as new guidebook.

definition: in very good condition (also like new ADV). (SYN in perfect condition)
example: Second-hand but good as new guidebook.

definition: exactly what it appears to be; real. (SYN authentic).
example: Genuine antique grandfather clock.

definition: old, and often very valuable. (N: antique).
example: Genuine antique grandfather clock.

definition: new or as good as new. (SYN in perfect condition).
example: The 8-day mechanism is in mint condition.

definition: a thing made as a copy of an earlier object or style. (V: reproduce sth).
example: Reproduction ancient Egyptian statue.

definition: belonging to a period of history from thousands of years ago.
example: Reproduction ancient Egyptian statue.

definition: (of a machine) repaired so that it is in good condition.
example: Fully reconditioned exercise bike.

definition: materials used to wrap and protect goods sold in shops.
example: Fully reconditioned exercise bike with original packaging.

definition: very great (a resounding success/defeat/win/victory).
example: Your pizza chain's been a resounding success.

definition: happen in a particular way, often unexpectedly.
example: How did things turn out so well for you?

definition: a way of doing things that has brought success.
example: What's the secret of your success?

definition: an unexpected but important event (a stroke of luck).
example: I had a stroke of luck early on.

definition: qualities that exist and can be developed (fulfil/realize your potential = use your natural abilities to achieve what you hoped to achieve).
example: A talented young chef who was really keen to fulfil his potential.

definition: not make a single mistake.
example: He never put a foot wrong.
persian: هرگز اشتباه نکردن/سیر درست را پیمودن

definition: succeed in controlling or dealing with a problem.
example: We had to work together to overcome all the obstacles in our way.

definition: a situation or event that makes it hard for you to achieve sth.
example: There were obstacles in our way.

definition: stopping sb from doing sth.
example: The obstacles were in our way.

definition: fail completely.
example: We nearly came unstuck when the first restaurant was flooded.

definition: succeed in achieving a goal; become successful.
example: Eventually we made it.

definition: an important development that may lead to an achievement or agreement (make/achieve a breakthrough).
example: You made a big breakthrough after you were on that TV show.

definition: become more and more successful.
example: We went from strength to strength after that.

definition: make sth succeed, especially a business or marriage.
example: Did Don make a go of the business?

definition: unable to do or understand sth because it is too hard.
example: He was way out of his depth.

definition: difficult to do or deal with (a tricky situation/question/problem).
example: It's a tricky situation to deal with.

definition: facing difficult problems or opposition.
example: Sue's really up against it.

definition: get worse in quality, health, etc. (SYN deteriorate).
example: I'm afraid the marriage is going downhill.

definition: receive the lowest score in an exam. (OPP come top).
example: Carla came bottom in the exams.

definition: only just succeed in passing an exam.
example: I only just scraped through.
persian: به سختی قبول شدن/با نمره لب مرزی قبول شدن

definition: make sb disappointed because you haven't behaved well or done what you said you would do.
example: Mum thinks we've let her down.

definition: be too old to do what you used to be able to do.
example: That boxer is past it, surely.
persian: (عمر) کسی گذشته بودن/پیرتر از آن بودن

definition: If a person in public life makes a comeback, they start doing sth again which they had stopped doing.
example: He still wants to make a comeback.

definition: a film, play, book, party, etc. that is not successful. (V: flop).
example: I hear the film was a flop.

definition: complete (used to describe sth bad). (SYN absolute).
example: An unmitigated disaster.

definition: by a large amount or 'very far'.
example: It cost way over $1,000.

definition: time seems to pass very quickly.
example: Time flies when you get older.

definition: sometimes but not regularly. (SYN now and again).
example: I get depressed from time to time.

definition: at the right time and not before.
example: I will go to university in due course.

definition: used to say that sth should happen soon or should have happened already. (SYN it's high time).
example: It's about time I started a pension.

definition: in the past but not now.
example: At one time I wanted to be a journalist.

word: do sth at the last minute
definition: do sth at the latest possible time before sth else happens. (SYN leave sth to/till the last minute).
example: I do everything at the last minute.
persian: کاری را در آخرین لحظه انجام دادن

definition: thinking now about the past, often with a different view from the one you had then. (SYN looking back).
example: In retrospect, I wish I'd gone to university.

definition: for a short period of time but not permanently.
example: For the time being I'm happy where I am.

definition: old-fashioned in ideas, ways, etc.
example: My parents are a bit behind the times.

definition: gradually.
example: I've become more tolerant over time.

definition: before you were born or before you can remember.
example: Elvis Presley was a bit before my time.

definition: with the ability to understand a situation only after it has happened (with the benefit of hindsight).
example: With hindsight I should've worked harder.
persian: با در نظر گرفتن نتیجه/با نگاه عقل پس از واقعه

definition: at a point within a period of time.
example: It rained during the day.

definition: continuously within a period of time.
example: It rained throughout the day.

definition: a particular period of history.
example: We're living in the nuclear age.

definition: a period of time with a particular quality or character.
example: It was the beginning of a new era.

definition: increase the length of time of sth. (OPP curtail FML).
example: They're going to extend my visa.

definition: make sth last longer. (OPP curtail FML).
example: The drugs will prolong her life.

definition: a period of time between two events or two parts of sth, e.g. a play.
example: Buses run at regular intervals.

definition: a period of time when sth stops.
example: We met again after a ten-year gap.

definition: a short period of time when you stop what you are doing and rest.
example: I get a coffee break and lunch break at work.

definition: a short period of time or of a particular activity.
example: She had a short spell working for an oil company.

definition: a period that forms part of an activity. A difficult period of time that sb/sth passes through (stage is also possible).
example: I stopped for water at one stage.

definition: a period of time that forms part of a process or the development of sth.
example: It's just a phase that most teenagers go through.

definition: all the verbs describe the process of time; elapse is FML; pass and go by are often used with an adverb to describe how time happens.
example: Two years passed / elapsed / went by before I saw her again.

definition: quickly (after sth happens). In a short period of time from now. A short period after sb/sth. A short period before sb/sth.
example: I'll be with you soon/shortly.

definition: a friendly informal meeting or party. (Syn: get-together).
example: I thought the do at Coleen's would be a good laugh.

definition: an enjoyable experience.
example: It was a good laugh.

definition: a boring or annoying occasion or situation.
example: It was a bit of a drag.

definition: bad, unpleasant, or of poor quality (a lousy film, lousy weather).
example: Yeah, lousy I thought.

definition: a pound (£) in money (PL quid NOT quids).
example: Asking people to pay twenty quid was a bit of a rip-off.

definition: a thing that is not worth what you pay for it. (V: rip sb off).
example: A bit of a rip-off.

definition: not generous with money. (SYNS tight, stingy).
example: Coleen is a bit tight-fisted.

definition: very bad or unpleasant (a vile smell). (SYN disgusting).
example: Who was that vile bloke?

definition: a man. (SYN guy).
example: Who was that vile bloke in the black leather jacket?

definition: an annoying person or situation. (SYN a pain in the neck).
example: Yeah, he was a pain, wasn't he?

definition: complain (about sth) in a way that annoys people.
example: He spent ages moaning about his flatmate.

definition: a toilet.
example: When I got up and went to the loo.

definition: steal sth. (SYN nick sth).
example: He pinched my drink.

definition: used to say you think sb's behaviour is rude or inappropriate. (SYN What a cheek!).
example: What a nerve!

definition: used to address sb you love, and by some people in shops as a friendly way of addressing customers, particularly women.
example: What would you like, love?

definition: not having any money.
example: I'm completely broke.

definition: very hungry. (SYN dying for sth to eat).
example: What's for lunch? I'm starving.

definition: a short sleep.
example: I might have a kip after lunch.

definition: elegant and expensive.
example: They stayed in a very posh hotel.

definition: interested in things that don't concern you.
example: I'm careful what I say to Cath; she's very nosy.

definition: an infectious illness.
example: She picked up a bug on holiday.

definition: be very interested in sth as a hobby.
example: They're both into extreme sports.

definition: defeat sb very heavily (often used when talking about sport). (SYN thrash sb).
example: Our team got absolutely hammered yesterday. We lost 5-1.
persian: کسی را به سختی شکست دادن

definition: deceive and trick sb, especially in order to get money from them.
example: I think that builder conned us.

definition: criticism. (SYN stick).
example: He's taken a lot of flak over this issue.

definition: silly (sometimes in an amusing way).
example: It was rather a daft thing to say.

definition: thanks. (SYN cheers).
example: Here's your change. ~ Ta.

definition: causing suspicion; possibly dishonest.
example: His idea sounds a bit dodgy.

definition: calm and relaxed. (SYN easy-going).
example: He's very laid-back.

definition: a large amount of noise. (SYN din).
example: What a terrible racket!

definition: an action you will take if there is no other option (as a last resort SYN if all else fails).
example: We can borrow money if need be, but it's a last resort.

word: it's more trouble than it's worth
definition: used to say the disadvantages of sth are greater than the advantages.
example: Frankly it's more trouble than it's worth.

definition: a situation in which you have the advantages of two things without any disadvantages.
example: He's got the best of both worlds.
persian: بهترین وضعیت ممکن/هر دو جنبه خوب را داشتن

definition: look stupid or be less respected because of sth you have done.
example: She didn't want to lose face.
persian: آبرو ریزی کردن/اعتبار خود را از دست دادن

word: keep your feet on the ground
definition: remain sensible and realistic about life.
example: He'll do well as long as he keeps his feet on the ground.

definition: relax and enjoy yourself.
example: She needs to let her hair down a bit.

definition: try to do sth that will almost certainly fail.
example: I think she's fighting a losing battle.
persian: نبرد شکست خورده را ادامه دادن/تلاش بیهوده کردن

definition: used to express doubts about a surprisingly good situation.
example: Sounds too good to be true, doesn't it?
persian: باور نکردنی (از خوشحالی زیاد)/خیلی خوب است که واقعی باشد

word: live/be in a world of your own
definition: spend your time imagining things, and not be aware of things around you.
example: He lives in a world of his own.
persian: در عالم خود بودن/غرق در تخیلات بودن

definition: an action you will take if there is no other option. (SYN as a last resort)
example: So you may have to sell your car. ~ Yes, if all else fails.
persian: اگر هیچ چیز دیگری کار نکند

word: go in one ear and out (of) the other
definition: If sth goes in one ear and out of the other, you forget it very quickly.
example: New words seem to go in one ear and out the other.
persian: از این گوش شنیدن و از آن گوش در کردن

definition: suddenly I cannot remember sth.
example: When I want to say something, my mind goes a complete blank.
persian: ذهن کاملاً خالی شدن/مطلب را فراموش کردن

definition: be successful (get somewhere = make progress; get nowhere = make no progress).
example: You'll get there in the end.

definition: used to say that it is not useful doing sth. (SYNS there's no point in + -ing, it's no use + -ing).
example: It's no good moaning about it.

word: I (you/he, etc.) could do with sth
definition: I (/you/he, etc.) need sth.
example: Maybe I could do with some extra lessons.

definition: be thinking of sb/sth for a particular purpose.
example: Do you have anyone in mind?

word: off the top of my head
definition: without thinking about sth carefully.
example: Not off the top of my head, no.

definition: used when advising sb what to do. (SYN the best thing (to do is ...)).
example: Your best bet is to talk to your teacher.
persian: بهترین کار (برای شما) این است که

definition: used to say you don't expect sth to happen even though sb said it would.
example: Bob's coming, isn't he? Don't hold your breath.

definition: used to say that sth is a result that is certain to happen.
example: It's a foregone conclusion.

definition: used to emphasize you are keen to do sth.
example: Are you going to the party? You bet.

definition: used to agree completely with what sb has just said.
example: It's very cold today. You can say that again.

definition: used to express your disappointment that sth is not going to happen.
example: Have you got Saturday off? No such luck, I'm afraid.

definition: used ironically to say you don't believe what sb has told you.
example: Sal said she's too busy to help us. A likely story.

definition: used to say you don't know sth. (SYNS Don't ask me, Your guess is as good as mine).
example: Where's Patsy? I haven't the faintest idea.

word: it's been one of those days
definition: used to say you have had a hard day.
example: You look very stressed. Yes, it's been one of those days.

definition: used to say there is no reason for sb not to do sth.
example: Shall I apply for that job? You've got nothing to lose.
persian: چیزی برای از دست دادن نداری

definition: used to say that you think sth cannot be true and must be a joke. (SYNS You're joking, You can't be serious).
example: Rani's going out with a film star. You're kidding.

definition: used when several unpleasant or unfortunate things happen on the same day.
example: I hurt my toe, then I burnt my hand. Oh dear. It's not your day, is it?

definition: used to say that sth is not at all possible or not allowed. (SYN no chance).
example: Can we go in if we're not members? No way.

definition: used to add politeness to a question. (Also: Do you happen to know if they're married?).
example: Do you know if they're married, by any chance?

word: If you don't mind my/me asking
definition: used before a question which you think may be sensitive.
example: If you don't mind my asking, how much did it cost?

definition: used to introduce an explanation, and often one that suggests there is a problem.
example: We'd like to see you, but the thing is, we don't know what time we'll get there.

definition: used to emphasize the comparative; equally good, bad, interesting, etc.
example: I think the film is every bit as good as his last one.

definition: used to say that you can never be certain about future events, so anything is possible.
example: I may get the job – you never know.

definition: used before giving sb surprising or exciting news.
example: Guess what! Ed and Sue are getting married.

definition: used to introduce information which is true but surprising.
example: He doesn't look rich, but believe it or not, he owns a castle in Bavaria.

definition: used to emphasize the fact that sth is not surprising.
example: He's been working since 7 o'clock this morning, so no wonder he's tired.

definition: used after wh- questions to indicate surprise, and sometimes annoyance, about sth.
example: Where on earth did you get those boots?

definition: used to say that sth is true if there are no other factors affecting it.
example: I would say, all things being equal, that women are better communicators than men.

definition: used to say, often with slight annoyance, that you don't know the reason or don't understand it.
example: The room is empty but, for some reason, we're not allowed to use it.

definition: used to agree reluctantly that sth is true.
example: I have to admit, he's very good at his job.

definition: from one place to another and then back again, many times.
example: We've been going back and forth all day.
persian: عقب و جلو/مرتب رفت و آمد کردن

definition: more than anything else.
example: First and foremost we need a plan.
persian: قبل از هر چیز/اول از همه

definition: for a long time.
example: I thought long and hard before taking the job.

definition: at some time in the future.
example: They'll be here sooner or later.

definition: with the back where the front should be.
example: You're wearing your jumper back to front.

definition: busy and noisy activity.
example: I enjoy the hustle and bustle of city life.

definition: a process of trying to solve a problem in different ways until you are successful.
example: I learnt how to use a computer by trial and error.

definition: things you want to achieve.
example: What are our aims and objectives?

definition: rules.
example: That's against the rules and regulations.

definition: safe and peaceful conditions in society when people obey the law.
example: Who is responsible for law and order?

definition: happy and lively.
example: Max was very bright and cheerful today.

definition: safely; not harmed, damaged, lost, etc.
example: The children got home safe and sound.

word: sick and tired of (SYN fed up with sth)
definition: bored with or annoyed about sth, and wanting it to stop.
example: I'm sick and tired of this weather.

definition: choose only those things that you like or want.
example: He can't really afford to pick and choose.

definition: push in a rough way.
example: They were pushing and shoving behind us.

definition: the offering of money or another incentive to sb to persuade them to take part in an activity, usually something dishonest.
example: There are still allegations of bribery and corruption in the police force.

definition: well behaved.
example: The kids were as good as gold today.
persian: مثل طلا بودن (خیلی خوب رفتار کردن)

definition: extremely light.
example: She was as light as a feather.

definition: cannot see well.
example: I'm afraid I'm blind as a bat.

definition: cannot hear well.
example: My father is deaf as a post.

definition: very strong.
example: He's as strong as an ox.

definition: very thin.
example: My sister's as thin as a rake.

definition: very quiet.
example: The baby's been as quiet as a mouse.

definition: white with fear or illness.
example: Ken went as white as a sheet.
persian: مثل گچ سفید (از ترس یا بیماری)

definition: very embarrassed.
example: Sally went as red as a beetroot.

definition: extremely dry.
example: The ground is as dry as a bone.

definition: selling very quickly or in large numbers.
example: The new model is selling like hot cakes.

definition: slept very well.
example: I slept like a log last night.

definition: was very successful.
example: The plan worked like a dream.
persian: عالی کار کردن/مثل رؤیا عمل کردن

definition: a bad memory.
example: Sometimes I've got a mind like a sieve.
